Author: abstractbill
Content: I already go to the gym for an hour every day at 5am.  It's actually not so much a problem of getting to sleep - I can almost always do that.  The trouble is more that I'm a very light sleeper and if anything disturbs me at night I can never get back to sleep.

Author: transburgh
Title: Open Your Social Network or Face Wired's Wrath!

Author: pg
Content:
Even during Viaweb I still slept 8 hours a night (roughly 3-11). The most productive people rarely have more than 6 hours or so of really concentrated work per day, except in emergencies. If you can ensure you get that every day, you don't need to economize on sleep.

My way of getting those 6 solid hours was a common hacker solution to the problem: I used the hours between 9 pm and 3 am, when no one could interrupt me.

Author: ivankirigin
Content:
indeed. The blog was really a good read sometimes.

That fake steve got up in rankings on most important tech people is proof of that :)

Author: wr1472
Content:
Salary is market rate, I think I may push for a shorter trial period, or more importantly a clause saying I will get a minimum amount - say 1% which we can then negotiate an increase on in 3 months.

To be honest a trial period of 1.5 or 3 months seems inconsequential, what I am mindful of is at the end of the trial period, they change their minds and say they're not going to offer me any equity.

Author: estherschindler
Title: Geek Bonding (or How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Star Trek)
Content: The manager of a team of programmers is faced with a unique challenge: how to apply general principles to the weird and lead the unleadable so as to create a functioning group out of the unsocial. Blake Watson examines techniques and stereotypes that serve to create strong teams.

Author: pg
Content:
A startup is right to want a trial period for such an early employee, but 3 months is on the long side. Half that should be enough for them to decide.

The percentage is impossible to predict. On average maybe 2% for a hacker. Less if they're post series A, or the salary is substantial.

Author: ivankirigin
Content:
I think I agree, but that's only because I'm a cheap bastard. Also, I often stop myself and realize I'm biased towards thinking a cab is a better deal when it is moving faster -- as if I can magically avoid traffic and stop lights when I'm driving.

But I suppose the point is that user pain needn't be rational.

Author: wr1472
Content: I think what is negotiable in 3 months is the amount of equity. what I may ask for is the guarantee of some (read minimum amount of) equity in 3 months written into my contract.

Author: ntoshev
Content: Copyright infringement is often publicly referred to as theft. So there is obviously an overlap in people's minds.
